required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of Herceptin (Trastuzumab) in Combination With Whole Brain Radiotherapy in Patients With HER-2 Positive Breast Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicenter, Open Label Study to Assess the Effect of Trastuzumab + Whole Brain Radiotherapy (WBRT) on Brain Metastases From HER-2 Positive Breast Cancer. (bHERt-2)

brief_summary.textblock: This single-arm, multicenter, open-label study will evaluate the efficacy and safety of Herceptin (trastuzumab) in combination with whole brain radiotherapy on brain metastases in patients with HER-2 positive breast cancer. The patients will receive Herceptin 4 mg/kg (loading dose) followed by 2 mg/kg for a maximum of 18 weekly cycles. The anticipated time on study treatment is 18 weeks.

clinical_study.why_stopped: Study was prematurely terminated due to difficulties experienced in recruiting patients in a reasonable timeframe.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Brain Objective Response According to Response Evaluation Criteria In Solid Tumors (RECIST) Criteria at Cycle 7
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and Cycle 7 (Week 7, approximately 5 weeks after completion of whole brain radiotherapy [WBRT])
primary_outcome.description: Brain objective response was defined as either a complete response (CR) or partial response (PR), provided that there was no increase in steroid requirements or worsening of neurological signs and symptoms. CR was defined as the disappearance of all central nervous system (CNS) lesions. PR was defined as a greater than or equal to (≥) 30 percent (%) reduction in the volumetric sum of all measurable CNS lesions.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Brain Objective Response According to RECIST Criteria at Cycle 15
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and Cycle 15 (Week 15, approximately 13 weeks after completion of WBRT)
secondary_outcome.description: Brain objective response was defined as either a CR or PR, provided that there was no increase in steroid requirements or worsening of neurological signs and symptoms. CR was defined as the disappearance of all CNS lesions. PR was defined as ≥30% reduction in the volumetric sum of all measurable CNS lesions.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Brain Objective Response Defined According to RECIST Criteria at the Final Visit
secondary_outcome.time_frame: BL and 4 weeks after Cycle 15 (Week 15, approximately 13 weeks after completion of WBRT) or the last dose of study treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Brain objective response was defined as either a CR or PR), provided that there was no increase in steroid requirements, or worsening of neurological signs and symptoms. CR was defined as the disappearance of all CNS lesions. PR was defined as ≥30% reduction in the volumetric sum of all measurable CNS lesions.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, weekly for 3 weeks (pre-WBRT phase), Cycles 1 through 15 (treatment phase Weeks 1 through 15), and 4 weeks after Cycle 15 (Week 15) or the last dose of study treatment
secondary_outcome.description: The number of participants surviving at the final visit.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, weekly for 3 weeks (pre-WBRT phase), Cycles 1 through 15 (treatment phase Weeks 1 through 15), and 4 weeks after Cycle 15 (Week 15) or the last dose of study treatment
secondary_outcome.description: B-PFS was defined as the time from the date of first study drug assumption and the date of documented evidence of brain progression (defined as appearance of new brain metastases or progression of pre-existing lesions) or death for brain progression, whichever came first. Progression in other metastatic sites, deaths not due to brain-progression and withdrawals due to adverse events were to be considered as competing risk.

arm_group.description: Participants received an initial loading dose of 4 milligrams per kilogram (mg/kg) trastuzumab intravenous (i.v.), followed by weekly doses of 2 mg/kg i.v. for up to 18 weeks.

intervention.description: Initial loading dose of 4 mg/kg i.v. infusion, followed by weekly doses of 2 mg/kg for up to 18 weeks.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adult patients, >/=18 years of age
- Diagnosis of breast carcinoma with HER-2 overexpression
- At least one measurable brain metastasis
- Patients for whom, according to investigator assessment, whole brain radiotherapy is the best therapeutic option
- Performance status (WHO) </=2
- Life expectancy >/=3 months
Exclusion Criteria:
- Presence of neoplastic meningitis
- Any prior radiotherapy to the brain
- Patients for whom, according to investigator assessment, stereotactic radiotherapy is the best therapeutic option
- Previous neoplasms, other than breast carcinoma, within 5 years since enrolment

group.title: Trastuzumab Monotherapy
group.description: Participants received an initial loading dose of 4 milligrams per kilogram (mg/kg) trastuzumab intravenously (i.v.) on Day 1, followed by doses of 2 mg/kg trastuzumab i.v. once weekly for up to 18 weeks.

baseline.population: Intent to treat (ITT) population included all consented participants who received study treatment.

group.title: Trastuzumab Monotherapy
group.description: Participants received an initial loading dose of 4 mg/kg trastuzumab i.v. on Day 1, followed by doses of 2 mg/kg trastuzumab i.v. once weekly for up to 18 weeks.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Brain Objective Response According to Response Evaluation Criteria In Solid Tumors (RECIST) Criteria at Cycle 7
outcome.description: Brain objective response was defined as either a complete response (CR) or partial response (PR), provided that there was no increase in steroid requirements or worsening of neurological signs and symptoms. CR was defined as the disappearance of all central nervous system (CNS) lesions. PR was defined as a greater than or equal to (≥) 30 percent (%) reduction in the volumetric sum of all measurable CNS lesions.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline and Cycle 7 (Week 7, approximately 5 weeks after completion of whole brain radiotherapy [WBRT])
outcome.population: ITT population; 1 participant was not assessed at Cycle 7.

CR was defined as the disappearance of all CNS lesions. PR was defined as ≥30% reduction in the volumetric sum of all measurable CNS lesions.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline and Cycle 15 (Week 15, approximately 13 weeks after completion of WBRT)

CR was defined as the disappearance of all CNS lesions. PR was defined as ≥30% reduction in the volumetric sum of all measurable CNS lesions.
measure.population: ITT population; 1 participant was not assessed at the final visit.

outcome.title: Overall Survival
outcome.description: The number of participants surviving at the final visit.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, weekly for 3 weeks (pre-WBRT phase), Cycles 1 through 15 (treatment phase Weeks 1 through 15), and 4 weeks after Cycle 15 (Week 15) or the last dose of study treatment
outcome.population: ITT population; survival status of 1 participant was unknown at the final visit.

group.title: Trastuzumab Monotherapy
group.description: Participants received an initial loading dose of 4 mg/kg trastuzumab i.v. on Day 1, followed by doses of 2 mg/kg trastuzumab i.v. once weekly for up to 18 weeks.

measure.title: Overall Survival
measure.description: The number of participants surviving at the final visit.
measure.population: ITT population; survival status of 1 participant was unknown at the final visit.

outcome.title: Brain Progression-Free Survival (B-PFS)
outcome.description: B-PFS was defined as the time from the date of first study drug assumption and the date of documented evidence of brain progression (defined as appearance of new brain metastases or progression of pre-existing lesions) or death for brain progression, whichever came first. Progression in other metastatic sites, deaths not due to brain-progression and withdrawals due to adverse events were to be considered as competing risk.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, weekly for 3 weeks (pre-WBRT phase), Cycles 1 through 15 (treatment phase Weeks 1 through 15), and 4 weeks after Cycle 15 (Week 15) or the last dose of study treatment
outcome.population: Due to the premature interruption of the study and the small number of enrolled participants (3 nerolled), all participant data were listed only, without any descriptive statistics or data analysis. The endpoint of B-PFS was thus not analyzed.

group.title: Trastuzumab Monotherapy
group.description: Participants received an initial loading dose of 4 mg/kg trastuzumab i.v. on Day 1, followed by doses of 2 mg/kg trastuzumab i.v. once weekly for up to 18 weeks.

measure.title: Brain Progression-Free Survival (B-PFS)
measure.description: B-PFS was defined as the time from the date of first study drug assumption and the date of documented evidence of brain progression (defined as appearance of new brain metastases or progression of pre-existing lesions) or death for brain progression, whichever came first. Progression in other metastatic sites, deaths not due to brain-progression and withdrawals due to adverse events were to be considered as competing risk.
measure.population: Due to the premature interruption of the study and the small number of enrolled participants (3 nerolled), all participant data were listed only, without any descriptive statistics or data analysis. The endpoint of B-PFS was thus not analyzed.

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse events were reported from randomization up through 28 days after the final study drug treatment.
reported_events.desc: Safety was assessed in all consented participants who received study treatment.

group.title: Trastuzumab Monotherapy
group.description: Participants received an initial loading dose of 4 mg/kg trastuzumab i.v. on Day 1, followed by doses of 2 mg/kg trastuzumab i.v. once weekly for up to 18 weeks.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The Study being conducted under this Agreement is part of the Overall Study. Investigator is free to publish in reputable journals or to present at professional conferences the results of the Study, but only after the first publication or presentation that involves the Overall Study. The Sponsor may request that Confidential Information be deleted and/or the publication be postponed in order to protect the Sponsor's intellectual property rights.
